solution.text:
volume of air inside the model = Volume of the cylinder + volume of the cones
Now volume of the cylinder\(=[\pi \times r^2\times l]\) radius of the cylinder=\(_{k}_\) and l=_{j}_
\(\Rightarrow \frac {22}7 \times _{k}_^2 \times _{j}_=_{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*j,2)}}_\)
volume of the cones on the sides the cylinders\(=2\times [ \frac 13 \times \pi \times r^2 \times height]\)
height of the cylinders = height of the cone= _{j}_
volume of the cones\(= 2\times [ \frac 13 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{k}_^2 \times _{j}_]= _{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*k*j/3,2)}}_\)
Now the volume of air inside the model\(=_{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*j,2)}}_ + _{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*k*j/3,2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*j+2*pi_val*k*k*j/3,2)}}_\,cm^3\)

content.text:
A science model was shaped like a cylinder with two similar cones attached at its two ends.
If the height of the cylinder and one of the cone is equal to _{j}_ cm and radius of the cylinder is _{k}_cm, find the volume of air inside this model.
